reviewText: I couldn't believe how refreshing it was to see Season 1 of Maude again, recently. I loved it the first time around on tv and I waited around to buy the DVD. But, now I find out that Season 2 isn't avaliable, yet! Bea Arthur was absolutely the best of the best with her timing for comedy, her deadpan, her great command over a scene. It took a few years between season 1 and season 2 of The Mary Tyler Moore Show to make it's appearance on DVD. Let's not do this to Maude. P.S. The theme song for the show is probably one of the best ever produced for a single character. Love her and the show!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sony has let Season 2 collect dust even though the episodes from that Season have already been remastered for DVD release. Clips of Season 2 episodes such as "Maude's Facelift" were used in their "Ladies Night" DVD promos in 2007 which also featured Bewitched, Jeannie, Charlie's Angels, The Nanny etc. They probably felt it would not sell well enough to warrant a release.Well, now that our dear Bea has left us, I have watched sales for Season 1 climb from the 2000's way up into the Top 100 on Amazon's DVD sales chart. This proves just how much the casual viewer takes an interest in a performer once they are gone.Bea has also always had a huge following in the gay community who would snap this release up in a heartbeat.Sony, if you don't have plans to release any more "Maude", at least license it out to a company like Shout Factory who will. After all, you finally relented and did that with "Designing Women", so show some respect and give Bea her due, please!

reviewText: With so many bad shows now on DVD, it is shocking to discover Maude still has not made it to the list of classic TV shows. Unlike many other series, Maude actually IMPROVED with each passing season, instead of deteriorating in writing and style. Maude deserves resurrection now.

reviewText: Bea Arthur died last year and now we have lost Rue McClanahan. Someone at Sony doesn't have business sense. Now with the death of these two Golden Girls, which already have the complete series released on dvd, there will be a strong demand for Maude. The show was always A+ with Adrienne Barbeau as the sexy daughter Carol and Bill Macy as the wimp husband Walter. Conrad Bain also got his start before "Different Strokes" as Arthur. Esther Role was good as Florida, which lead to her own show 'Good Times." The show was well loved, which resulting in a spin off. Sony needs to rush these dvds as soon as possible. Demand should really be stong now. If Sony can produced the right marketing material, they will make a profit. Lastly, it would be nice to have reflections of Adrienne Barbeau, Bill Macy and Conrad Bain talking about the show and their relationship with Bea Arhtur and Rue McClanahan. Someone tell us who to email or write to get all of these classics on DVD.
summary: A Golden Opportunity Missed: More Maude on DVD Please
Title: N/A

reviewText: Now that the amazing Beatrice Arthur is gone I sincerely hope Sony will release the remaining 5 seasons of "Maude".  Six seasons of "All in the Family" are already out and the other spin-offs like "Good Times" and "The Jeffersons" have most, if not all of their seasons out on DVD already.  What is Sony waiting for when it comes to releasing Season 2 of "Maude"?  This was not only a top-rated, ground-breaking, Emmy-awarding winning show but one of the best sitcoms ever on TV!  Out of respect for the great Bea Arthur, Sony should get off their butts and give the fans what they want - more seasons of Bea Arthur in "Maude"!
summary: God'll get you for that Sony!

reviewText: Why can't classic shows like this be released? The excuse heard most commonly is there's not a large enough market for them to be produced. Haven't these companies ever heard of P.O.D. - Print On Demand????!!!! It really is maddening, I would like to see these shows again before I die & none of us are getting any younger.

reviewText: I can't believe that Sony stopped at Season 1 of Maude for DVD. A groundbreaking Norman Lear series that covered issues never before discussed on television. Every season of the show is better than the one before it. I think it is a shame that the people at Sony, especially after the passing of Bea Arthur, still won't release some of her best work for her fans. You know, I read the video store trade-papers (Home Media Retailing and Video Business) and the studios are complaining and scared because every month this year, DVD sales have taken a fall. Gee, I wonder why? Here's one series that would sell and make some profit for the company. I think Sony's home video department management leaves much to be desired and they need new people with new ideas there. There are many other series that stopped at season 1, but this one has the highest ratings of all of them!
Title: N/A

Bea is gone, but we want the memories of her work!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: Yesterday, the world lost another great actress, brilliant comedienne of Beatrice Arthur. She was better known as Maude and I preferred Maude to her Dorothy Petrillo Zbornak on the "Golden Girls." Maude Findlay was just a better character and Bea Arthur played her perfectly with faults and all. She was the anti-Archie Bunker. I got the first season two years ago and I'm waiting for the second season. It's not fair that she's gone but they are keeping us from enjoying Maude. It's ironic because other shows reigned in syndication but not smart shows like Maude, too controversial or the audiences weren't paying attention to it. I still want my Maude now more than ever.
summary: More Maude Now More Than Ever!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just don't understand how these stupid executives don't follow through on continuing to release such classic television series like All in the Family, The Jeffersons,One Day at a Time, and Maude, because these shows already have a long standing built-in audience that will buy the dvd sets, also this will lead to new fans purchasing as well.Also, I don't think these idiots at Sony realize the enormous power of word of mouth here on Amazon, because I always find these customer reviews very helpful. Perhaps the powers at be from Sony should sell the rights of these classic tv shows to Shout Factory, because they do release their tv shows in complete dvd sets. Recently Shout Factory obtained the rights to The Facts of Life, after Sony released only 3 seasons. At this point I'm sure alot of fans would love to see more seasons released of Norman Lear's tv legacy.
Title: N/A
